channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: RTQ: Rethinking Video-language Understanding Based on Image-text Model
item.description: Recent advancements in video-language understanding have been established on the foundation of image-text models, resulting in promising outcomes due to the shared knowledge between images and videos.

item.title: Gaussian Grouping: Segment and Edit Anything in 3D Scenes
item.description: To address this issue, we propose Gaussian Grouping, which extends Gaussian Splatting to jointly reconstruct and segment anything in open-world 3D scenes.

item.title: Weighted Riesz Particles
item.description: Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods are simulated by local exploration of complex statistical distributions, and while bypassing the cumbersome requirement of a specific analytical expression for the target, this stochastic exploration of an uncertain parameter space comes at the expense of a large number of samples, and this computational complexity increases with parameter dimensionality.

item.title: Simple Transferability Estimation for Regression Tasks
item.description: We consider transferability estimation, the problem of estimating how well deep learning models transfer from a source to a target task.

item.title: Object Detector Differences when using Synthetic and Real Training Data
item.description: Collecting data while adhering to privacy legislation becomes increasingly difficult and annotating these large datasets is both a resource-heavy and time-consuming task.

item.title: Matching Weak Informative Ontologies
item.description: In this paper, these ontologies are named as weak informative ontologies (WIOs) and it is challenging for existing methods to matching WIOs.

item.title: Age-Based Scheduling for Mobile Edge Computing: A Deep Reinforcement Learning Approach
item.description: In the traditional definition of AoI, it is assumed that the status information can be actively sampled and directly used.

item.title: Trained MT Metrics Learn to Cope with Machine-translated References
item.description: Neural metrics trained on human evaluations of MT tend to correlate well with human judgments, but their behavior is not fully understood.

item.title: The Efficiency Spectrum of Large Language Models: An Algorithmic Survey
item.description: The rapid growth of Large Language Models (LLMs) has been a driving force in transforming various domains, reshaping the artificial general intelligence landscape.

item.title: StyleCrafter: Enhancing Stylized Text-to-Video Generation with Style Adapter
item.description: To address these challenges, we introduce StyleCrafter, a generic method that enhances pre-trained T2V models with a style control adapter, enabling video generation in any style by providing a reference image.

item.title: Automating Continual Learning
item.description: General-purpose learning systems should improve themselves in open-ended fashion in ever-changing environments.

item.title: GIFT: Generative Interpretable Fine-Tuning Transformers
item.description: For the latter, in contrast to the prior art that directly introduce new model parameters (often in low-rank approximation form) to be learned in fine-tuning with downstream data, we propose a method for learning to generate the fine-tuning parameters.

item.title: BCN: Batch Channel Normalization for Image Classification
item.description: Normalization techniques have been widely used in the field of deep learning due to their capability of enabling higher learning rates and are less careful in initialization.

item.title: Adversarial Score Distillation: When score distillation meets GAN
item.description: Existing score distillation methods are sensitive to classifier-free guidance (CFG) scale: manifested as over-smoothness or instability at small CFG scales, while over-saturation at large ones.

item.title: On the Out-Of-Distribution Robustness of Self-Supervised Representation Learning for Phonocardiogram Signals
item.description: Results: We experimentally demonstrate that, depending on its training distribution, the effectiveness of a fully-supervised model can degrade up to 32% when evaluated on unseen data, while SSL models only lose up to 10% or even improve in some cases.

item.title: Bayesian causal discovery from unknown general interventions
item.description: We consider the problem of learning causal Directed Acyclic Graphs (DAGs) using combinations of observational and interventional experimental data.

item.title: Removing Biases from Molecular Representations via Information Maximization
item.description: High-throughput drug screening -- using cell imaging or gene expression measurements as readouts of drug effect -- is a critical tool in biotechnology to assess and understand the relationship between the chemical structure and biological activity of a drug.

item.title: Abstract Syntax Tree for Programming Language Understanding and Representation: How Far Are We?
item.description: To do so, we compare the performance of models trained with code token sequence (Token for short) based code representation and AST-based code representation on three popular types of code-related tasks.

item.title: Towards Clinical Prediction with Transparency: An Explainable AI Approach to Survival Modelling in Residential Aged Care
item.description: Objectives: Develop an interpretable survival model for elderly residential aged care residents using advanced machine learning.

item.title: Towards Transparency in Coreference Resolution: A Quantum-Inspired Approach
item.description: Previous work extended the QNLP translation to discourse structure using points in a closure of Hilbert spaces.

item.title: Summarization-based Data Augmentation for Document Classification
item.description: Despite the prevalence of pretrained language models in natural language understanding tasks, understanding lengthy text such as document is still challenging due to the data sparseness problem.

item.title: A Preconditioned Interior Point Method for Support Vector Machines Using an ANOVA-Decomposition and NFFT-Based Matrix-Vector Products
item.description: In this paper we consider the numerical solution to the soft-margin support vector machine optimization problem.

item.title: Efficient Multimodal Semantic Segmentation via Dual-Prompt Learning
item.description: Existing approaches often fully fine-tune a dual-branch encoder-decoder framework with a complicated feature fusion strategy for achieving multimodal semantic segmentation, which is training-costly due to the massive parameter updates in feature extraction and fusion.

item.title: Effect of prolonged use of Smartphones on neck and wrist muscle fatigue using surface EMG
item.description: Prolonged smartphone usage is prevalent among young adults in Lima, Peru, with potential implications for musculoskeletal health.

item.title: OpenStereo: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Stereo Matching and Strong Baseline
item.description: Our extensive comparative analyses of StereoBase against numerous contemporary stereo matching methods on the SceneFlow dataset demonstrate its remarkably strong performance.

item.title: SPOT: Self-Training with Patch-Order Permutation for Object-Centric Learning with Autoregressive Transformers
item.description: Unsupervised object-centric learning aims to decompose scenes into interpretable object entities, termed slots.

item.title: PointBeV: A Sparse Approach to BeV Predictions
item.description: To address this, we propose PointBeV, a novel sparse BeV segmentation model operating on sparse BeV cells instead of dense grids.

item.title: SeaLLMs -- Large Language Models for Southeast Asia
item.description: Despite the remarkable achievements of large language models (LLMs) in various tasks, there remains a linguistic bias that favors high-resource languages, such as English, often at the expense of low-resource and regional languages.

item.title: Temperature Balancing, Layer-wise Weight Analysis, and Neural Network Training
item.description: In particular, the learning rate, which can be interpreted as a temperature-like parameter within the statistical mechanics of learning, plays a crucial role in neural network training.

item.title: Learning Anatomically Consistent Embedding for Chest Radiography
item.description: Self-supervised learning (SSL) approaches have recently shown substantial success in learning visual representations from unannotated images.

item.title: Adaptive Parameter-Free Robust Learning using Latent Bernoulli Variables
item.description: We present an efficient parameter-free approach for statistical learning from corrupted training sets.

item.title: CoLLiE: Collaborative Training of Large Language Models in an Efficient Way
item.description: This paper introduces CoLLiE, an efficient library that facilitates collaborative training of large language models using 3D parallelism, parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) methods, and optimizers such as Lion, Adan, Sophia, LOMO and AdaLomo.

item.title: Spatio-Temporal-Decoupled Masked Pre-training for Traffic Forecasting
item.description: Accurate forecasting of multivariate traffic flow time series remains challenging due to substantial spatio-temporal heterogeneity and complex long-range correlative patterns.

item.title: MLLMs-Augmented Visual-Language Representation Learning
item.description: Visual-language pre-training (VLP) has achieved remarkable success in multi-modal tasks, largely attributed to the availability of large-scale image-text datasets.

item.title: Language Model Agents Suffer from Compositional Generalization in Web Automation
item.description: We show that while existing prompted LMAs (gpt-3. 5-turbo or gpt-4) achieve 94. 0% average success rate on base tasks, their performance degrades to 24. 9% success rate on compositional tasks.

item.title: Negotiated Representations to Prevent Forgetting in Machine Learning Applications
item.description: By evaluating our method on these challenging datasets, we aim to showcase its potential for addressing catastrophic forgetting and improving the performance of neural networks in continual learning settings.

item.title: Learning Robust Precipitation Forecaster by Temporal Frame Interpolation
item.description: This achievement not only underscores the effectiveness of our methodologies but also establishes a new standard for deep learning applications in weather forecasting.

item.title: Prompt-Based Exemplar Super-Compression and Regeneration for Class-Incremental Learning
item.description: Replay-based methods in class-incremental learning (CIL) have attained remarkable success, as replaying the exemplars of old classes can significantly mitigate catastrophic forgetting.

item.title: RaDialog: A Large Vision-Language Model for Radiology Report Generation and Conversational Assistance
item.description: Conversational AI tools that can generate and discuss clinically correct radiology reports for a given medical image have the potential to transform radiology.

item.title: BAM-DETR: Boundary-Aligned Moment Detection Transformer for Temporal Sentence Grounding in Videos
item.description: However, they suffer from the issue of center misalignment raised by the inherent ambiguity of moment centers, leading to inaccurate predictions.

item.title: AlignBench: Benchmarking Chinese Alignment of Large Language Models
item.description: Alignment has become a critical step for instruction-tuned Large Language Models (LLMs) to become helpful assistants.

item.title: Exploiting Diffusion Prior for Generalizable Pixel-Level Semantic Prediction
item.description: Contents generated by recent advanced Text-to-Image (T2I) diffusion models are sometimes too imaginative for existing off-the-shelf property semantic predictors to estimate due to the immitigable domain gap.

item.title: Controlgym: Large-Scale Safety-Critical Control Environments for Benchmarking Reinforcement Learning Algorithms
item.description: This project serves the learning for dynamics & control (L4DC) community, aiming to explore key questions: the convergence of RL algorithms in learning control policies; the stability and robustness issues of learning-based controllers; and the scalability of RL algorithms to high- and potentially infinite-dimensional systems.

item.title: Advances in 3D Neural Stylization: A Survey
item.description: Building on such taxonomy, our survey first revisits the background of neural stylization on 2D images, and then provides in-depth discussions on recent neural stylization methods for 3D data, where we also provide a mini-benchmark on artistic stylization methods.

item.title: $\mathbb{Z}_2\times \mathbb{Z}_2$ Equivariant Quantum Neural Networks: Benchmarking against Classical Neural Networks
item.description: Our results show that the $\mathbb{Z}_2\times \mathbb{Z}_2$ EQNN and the QNN provide superior performance for smaller parameter sets and modest training data samples.

item.title: On the convergence of adaptive first order methods: proximal gradient and alternating minimization algorithms
item.description: Building upon recent works on linesearch-free adaptive proximal gradient methods, this paper proposes AdaPG$^{\pi, r}$, a framework that unifies and extends existing results by providing larger stepsize policies and improved lower bounds.

item.title: Routing-Guided Learned Product Quantization for Graph-Based Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search
item.description: It suffers from the large-scale $\mathcal{X}$ because a PG with full vectors is too large to fit into the memory, e. g., a billion-scale $\mathcal{X}$ in 128 dimensions would consume nearly 600 GB memory.

item.title: ElasticDiffusion: Training-free Arbitrary Size Image Generation
item.description: We propose ElasticDiffusion, a novel training-free decoding method that enables pretrained text-to-image diffusion models to generate images with various sizes.

item.title: Compact3D: Compressing Gaussian Splat Radiance Field Models with Vector Quantization
item.description: 3D Gaussian Splatting is a new method for modeling and rendering 3D radiance fields that achieves much faster learning and rendering time compared to SOTA NeRF methods.

item.title: Towards Assessing and Benchmarking Risk-Return Tradeoff of Off-Policy Evaluation
item.description: This efficient estimator is characterized by its capability to form the most advantageous policy portfolios, maximizing returns while minimizing risks during online deployment, a nuance that existing metrics typically overlook.
